question: At 05:00. We're seven minutes in. Private Miller, we are now going to ask you several questions. How do you feel?
answer: Uh, I feel a little queer sir. But... It's good. Good queer. Sir. Good queer, Sir. But...uh...even though I feel queer, Sir, I should mention that I'm also feeling quite gay...so, a little queer, but mostly gay.

question: Private Miller. When you think of your superiors, what emotions do you feel?
answer: This went out...Sir.

question: We will send someone in. Now answer the question. Private Miller? Answer the question.
answer: Oh...um...what was the question again?

question: What are your emotions towards your superiors?
answer: COUGH COUGH Fucking shit. Well, now that I think of it, it's strange that they are called my `superiors'. Does that make me their `inferior'? I mean, that's pretty fucked up. Hey! What the...what are you guys doing! Let go of me! Sir!!! Sir!!! Help me!!!

question: Of course not! Who wants a pocket full of coins? Seriously. Weighs down your pants, clangs around. With all this unnecessary new security everywhere, we'll be setting off alarms left and right! Excuse me, miss? Are you Sandra Danby Sorry, miss, but you've failed to show up to your divorce proceedings 4 times under court order. You've been served. Fuckin' eh. Nice! Hot Steppa! You think you know, chico/I know what Bo, don't know/touch them up and go - uh oh!/ Chi-chi-ching-chang!!! Just here to check out some units. Nope. You owe American Express $4068 dollars. Sorry, but you've been served. Everything! They should be able to collect garbage TWICE a week. Why not? As a tax payer, can't I say that? Come get my garbage a bit more! Is that so f- ing crazy? I'm not asking for free beer Tuesday's or anything. And the whole city would be more aesthetically pleasing and smell better. And don't pretend you can't smell it. Ever been to New York? Great place, smells like piss, though. Twice a week, cough might fix that. Hold on one sec. I need Dr. Terrence, immediately. Dr. Edgar Terrence. You're the guy who repeatedly refused to take care of the monkey tree that spills onto your neighbors property. And now, because of that, you've been served. Let me through, damnit. You're Joshua Aaron Corber? Sorry, but you've been served. Hey! Nice. New chicken fries.
answer: Dale! Mmm. Minty.

question: Hey Kyle. So, should we head back to my place and finish up the trilogy? Matrix
answer: Of course. But can we just head to my locker first? I left some stuff by mistake.

question: Sure.
answer: So, are you going to come over for dinner tomorrow, `cause my parents are beginning to think I made you up.

question: Well, yeah, I really want to meet them. Tomorrow, tomorrow, tomorrow...let me think.
answer: You don't have to feel weird about it. They know how old you are and they're fine with it. They just want to meet you and see that you're a cool guy and that I'm not dating you just because you're older.

question: Of course. I know that. It's just...tomorrow's tight. I've got a whole bunch of cases that I can finish tomorrow. It's probably going to take me into the night.
answer: Fuck. Well, then you have to just come over sometime this week or something, okay? `Cause it's getting weird for them.

question: I will. I promise. I'm not trying to avoid this, for real, I've just been crazy busy. Pardon?
answer: Mr. Edwards, he's my boyfriend. I'm 19. I moved here from Morocco.

question: Dude, you may be a teacher here, but we're about the same age, so don't get all high and mighty. It's not that weird. Frankly, it's natural. I'll wait in the car.
answer: So, do you want to get some food?

question: No...actually I can't. I have to go serve a guy.
answer: Now?

question: Yeah. It sucks. I'm sorry. We can hang out later though. You can come over.
answer: We'll see if Neo is truly the one.

question: Yo?
answer: Yo. It's Dale. Mind if I come by and pick up some shit? What's up, Saul.

question: What the fuck?!?
answer: What?

question: I didn't buzz you in. How the monkey did you get in here?
answer: Whoa...sorry, man. someone just let me in. I-

question: That's fucked up, man! This building is filled with fuckin' assholes. What else is the buzzer for? Fuck.
answer: I'll buzz next time, man. I'm real sorry. I'm just not familiar with your, uh...protocol yet.

question: Hey, stuff your sorry's i n a sack, bro. We're always cool. It's those fuckin' jaggoffs.
answer: Um...sure.

question: Brass tacs. I've got this new bud. Unfortunately, it's a few more bones, but fortunately, it's hands down the dopest fuckin' shit I ever smoked. And I've smoked some dope fuckin' shit.
answer: Better than that Blue Oyster weed?

question: Dude. Seriously. It's like if that Blue Oyster shit and the Afghan Kush I got had a baby, and meanwhile, the craziest Northern Lights and that red-ass Espresso Snowflake had a baby, and then by some miracle those babies met, and fucked - then this would be the shit they'd birth. Smell it.
answer: What is this? It's spectacular.

question: It's called Pineapple Express. My guy Red told me it's when this Hawaiian flood takes special dirt to the weed or some shit. It's pretty scientific. And I'm the only guy in the whole city who has it. And, its only ten bones more for a quarter.
answer: So...can I get a quarter?

question: No doubt. Just let me grab my scale. What's with the look? What?
answer: Where's the scale?

question: Oh shit! The scale. Be right back. You know what's weird? How sometimes, your brain just chooses to like, not keep things in it, you know? Fucking scale. Shit. Where is it?
answer: Holy shit! What the fuck is this thing?

question: Ah, the cross-joint. You've never seen one of these? Not surprising. They are, like, the apex of the vortex of joint engineering. NASA built the first one in the eighties.
answer: You can actually smoke that contraption?

question: You light all three ends at the same time, then, you smoke it as it resonates the main section, creating a "trifecta" of smoking power. It's like, three times as powerful as a normal joint.
answer: Well, be careful with that thing.

question: Dude...you wanna smoke this thing with me? I can't even light it on my own.
answer: Wow. So like, uh...so like, so like what do I do?

question: Alright. Firstly you light these two ends. Then I will light the tip, making the trifecta complete. Are you ready?
answer: Holy...

question: It's...uh, it's good to cough. COUGH It opens the COUGH capillaries...gets you twenty-five percent higher. And that, combined with the pineapple weed, and the cross-joint COUGH you're a good thirty to forty times higher. I don't know the exact math, but, pff, you're pretty fucking gong-showed. You know what I mean? It's crazy. The better the weed, the more I wish I could think of how to explain what's so good about it, but the...uh, the better it is, the less shit I can think of in total, you know? Okay, so, like, you've been buying from me for, like, a few months now and I really gotta ask. What's with the suit?
answer: I'm a process server.

question: You`re a servant? Like, a butler.
answer: No, process server. I'm hired to give people papers they don't want. It's pretty much the easiest job on earth.

question: Nice, man. Where'd you get that job?
answer: Well...uh, I got a totally useless degree two years ago, then I did nothing for a year, then my dad got so fed up he hooked me up. I got it pretty sweet, though. Today? I smoked like five joints, gave out some pieces of paper, and I ate some Burger King-

question: Hey man, did you get those new chicken fries?
answer: Yeah man. I'd get on that shit. They're fucking mind blowing. So, then I hot- boxed my car and then...got some action from my girlfriend.

question: Does she smoke pot?
answer: A little. She's in high school.

question: That's fuckin' sweet! Ilegal love! You're like Jerry Lee Lewis. I just read his biography.
answer: No, no. She's 19.

question: Oh. It's still cool I guess.
answer: Yeah, it's awesome, although I think she's getting old enough where she's realizing I don't do much. And these high school guys these days. They're all roided out and going to Harvard. Even on my best days, I look like a fat, dumb piece of shit next to them.

question: Whatever, man. It sounds like you got it pretty good. I wish I had a job that easy. Fuck.
answer: Dude...you've got, like, the actual easiest job in the world.

question: Hey! You're right, man. I never thought of it like that.
answer: You can actually do whatever the hell you want. You get to sleep all day and people come buy weed at night.

question: That's totally true. Except tomorrow. Thanks to that bitch daylight savings, I gotta go change my grandma's clocks forward at 7am. Or 8am. I seriously can't figure it out.
answer: Sorry to hear that.

question: Yo, so, like, what have these people done that you go after?
answer: Let's see...tonight I'm going after- Ted Jones. He forgot to pay his-

question: Dude! My guy, Red, gets his weed from a Ted Jones. He's, like, #1 supplier in town. Maybe it's him!
answer: I doubt that, man. There's probably a lot of Ted Joneses's out there.

question: Yeah, but not like this one, man! He's what I want to be one day. He's like the "Jesus of Weed". So...I guess he's like Jah. Or Scarface.
answer: Well Saul, that was crazy. Thanks.

question: No worries dude, peace.
answer: Oh shit on me.

question: Ha! Ha! Ha! Screech. Fucking hell. Hello?
answer: ...me in! Let me in! Let me in! Let me in! It's Dale! Let m--

question: Denton? Dale Denton?
answer: ...the love of shit, let me in! Pleeea-

question: ...fucking, don't smoke that shit if you can't handle it. Dude, whoa. What the fuck are-
answer: He fucking killed him, man!

question: Be quiet, man, I got neighbors-
answer: He killed him!

question: Somebody killed somebody?!?
answer: Yeah, man! I can't believe it. A cop! A lady, and a guy.

question: Somebody killed a cop, a lady and a guy?
answer: No! A guy!

question: A cop killed a guy?
answer: No! A cop and a guy killed another guy! The lady and the guy...No, a fucking woman, a police woman, and an old guy, shot a guy, a younger guy, in the fucking window at Ted's house!

question: Was the guy Ted?
answer: Which guy?

question: I don't know, the old guy who shot the guy?
answer: I don't fucking know. He was this big, old, grey haired guy with a gun, and he fucking took him, and he shot him! Right there in the fucking window! BAM!

question: I heard Ted's got grey hair!
answer: And they saw me! They saw me see them shoot the guy!

question: What!?! They saw you?!? Why the fuck did you come here? Did they follow you?!? Did they follow you here!?!
answer: No! I panicked. I was having a coughing fit, I crashed, I crashed into a car. Fuck, two cars. They must've heard at least. They knew someone was there.

question: But they don't know it's you?
answer: No. I don't think so. No.

question: So...they're not coming here? Cool. So, what's your game-plan? You gonna call the cops? Cause if you do, I'd appreciate it if you left my shit out of this shit.
answer: I'm not calling the cops - one of them was a cop. They could all be cops!

question: Did you see any blood? Was it sick?
answer: Yeah. I saw some blood.

question: I wonder who the guy he shot was?
answer: I don't know, who do drug dealers kill? It was probably another drug dealer. He was Asian. Are there Asian drug dealers.

question: Hell yeah, man. The Koreans teamed up with, like, the Vietnamese or some shit. They're crazy mother fuckers. Number two in town. Heh. Ted's cappin' the competition. Yo, you want some of this? So, like, exactly what was the sequence of happenings?
answer: I'm sitting across from Ted's smoking a massive joint of that weed you sold me-

question: Oh, the Pineapple Express. It's so rare it's almost a shame to smoke it, like killing a unicorn...with, like, a bomb.
answer: When I threw it...out...the window...

question: What?
answer: This weed is actually that rare?

question: Yeah, it's like, "the rarest".
answer: So, you are actually the only guy in town with this weed?

question: Fuckin' rights, I am. Red told me he was giving me an "exclusive sneak preview".
answer: And am I the only guy you gave it to?

question: Yeah. So, we're the only guys.
answer: But, like, another dealer, couldn't identify it, the pineapple weed? Like, if they found a roach of it, right?

question: I could. Why?
answer: We should go, we shouldn't be here! We should go!

question: No...seriously, why?
answer: I left a roach of this weed in front of Ted's house!

question: So what? I leave roaches all over fucking town.
answer: No, listen - they could find the roach and say, "This is pineapple weed, Saul's the only guy in town who has pineapple weed, therefore he must have witnessed the murder or know who did - let's go kill him."

question: Mother of fuck! Let's go!
answer: Wait!

question: Why!?! Let go of me! Let's get the fuck out of here!
answer: Saul, wait! Grab anything we might need, like your weed and money and stuff. Are you sure you're not forgetting anything?

question: Yes! Come on! Fuck! I forgot something! Dude, I was so scared going back, I thought there was gonna be guys there, and then you'd be gone, and there was this music in my head-
answer: We'll take the stairs, it'll be faster. Go back! Go back! Okay, man. We gotta try to relax.

question: Why?!?
answer: We don't want to draw attention.

question: Whose attention!?! You think they could be down there? In the Lobby? Right now!?!
answer: I don't know! Who knows? Just try to be cool.

question: What the fuck was that?
answer: That was bad - Calm! Calm! Calm! Oh. Pardon.

question: Okay, what do you know about Ted?
answer: What? Ted? Nothing. For all I know he's tracking us with space satellites right now! He's got grey hair, that's all I knew. Let's go to your place.

question: No way! What if they did see my license plate!?!
answer: Okay, so let's got to a hotel, or a motel, or a Holiday Inn.

question: Well, how much money do we have?
answer: All I've got is the seventy-five you gave me.

question: That's it!?!
answer: Well, how much money do you have?

question: Uh...nine bucks.
answer: Well, shut up then! I've got more than you!

question: Fine. Forget the hotel.
answer: I wish we could just go nowhere.

question: Okay...where's nowhere? So what do we know? Nothing. We may or may not be followed because we don't even know if he found the roach or not. And, we could just be completely crazy. But, the question is this
answer: He couldn't. Cause I'm in the woods. It's impossible! Unless he's, like, hanging on the bottom of the car or some shit, but I mean-

question: No, what I mean is, if Ted found the roach and identified the weed, how could he connect it to you?
answer: There's no way. He could only find out from Red.

question: Who is this Red guy?
answer: Red's pretty much a middleman between Ted and guys like me. And we're mad fucking tight. One time he convinced some girl he knew to give me a hand-job within, like, five minutes of me meeting her.

question: But let's say someone calls asking who he sold this pineapple weed to, he'll say you, because...why wouldn't he?
answer: Fuck that. That's bullshit. He would have called me if that happened. A hand-job, Dale! Imagine if I'd gotten you a hand job by now!

question: Yeah, but Saul, he's a fucking drug dealer.
answer: So? I'm a fuckin' drug dealer. What, you don't trust me then?

question: Um...I...call him. Yeah, sure, call him.
answer: Thank you!

question: Ow! Hello?
answer: Yo, Red. You okay man?

question: Saul! Oh. I, uh...stubbed my toe.
answer: Dude, watch the toes. Wear shoes in the house. But Red, I gotta get straight to brass tacs, I need a favor.

question: Sure man, anything. I'm Red.
answer: You sure as fuck are, buddy. So, you know how you gave me some of that pineapple express stuff? Don't tell anyone you gave it to me.

question: Sure man, no problem. Red swears it, hombre.
answer: So, can I come on over now?

question: So, can I come on over now?
answer: No! We should do it tomorrow!

question: I'm in the middle of a convo, man. Let's just go and get this shit over with.
answer: Come on, man. Tomorrow. I'm scared shitless. I want to think things through before I do anything. Let's go in the morning. Please.

question: Yeah...okay. Less scary shit happens in the day. Red?
answer: -I can hear him talking to someone, so- Yo! Saul? So, you're gonna come by in the morning?

question: Yeah, right after I see my grandma.
answer: Sure, your Grandma's retirement home- Ow! Fuckin' stupid god-damn toe. I, uh, is that the one on Granville and 41st.

question: Yeah man. I've only got one. So, we'll be chillin' by noon.
answer: Well, cool brother. Noon it is.

question: We should definitely hit up the casino again sometime.
answer: For sure. We should definitely hit up the casino.

question: I always liked smoking weed in the forest.
answer: I'm going to go call Angie. Make up some bull shit.

question: Dale...wait! Yeah, the phone...I mean, I don't know how this shit works, but...can cops... you said they might be cops...could they triangulate our phones or trace `em or some shit like that? I don't know. I feel like I've seen that. I mean, shit Dale, maybe they can trace them when we're not even on them!
answer: What the fuck is that?! Are we on fucking "Lost"?! What the hell is that?!

question: It's them!!! Holy fuck. That was close.
answer: You know what? You're right. We should just get rid of them. We should just smash `em. Fuck. I just bought this thing. Maybe I can just take the batteries out?

question: No! Smash it! Shit!
answer: What the fuck was that?!

question: Fuck! I was trying to throw it at that tree!
answer: What tree?

question: That one. It was a cheap piece of shit. Came free with the plan. It must've smashed when it landed.
answer: Who the fuck knows?!? I don't know!! Why couldn't you have just smashed it on a rock like a normal person?

question: I was trying to smash it! How often does a guy smash things? I'm rusty. Fuck.
answer: Did you at least see where it landed?

question: Over there, somewhere. Wait! We could call it!
answer: With what? I just smashed my phone!

question: Man, it's not like they got McGuyver workin' on the case. I bet they can't even triangulate it.
answer: Well, then you shouldn't have said anything, cause now you've convinced me that they can!

question: Fine! Fine. Let's just find the stupid thing and get back to doing what we were doin'.
answer: Do you see it?

question: Dude, this is the scariest place I've ever been in my life. You ever see that movie where all the people are in the woods and they slowly get killed?
answer: The "Blair Witch Project."

question: No...Shit. That one's way scarier than the one I was thinking of. Mine had Arnold Shwartzenegger in it. Now I'm thinking of the fucking Blair Witch.
answer: Stop!

question: What-
answer: Sshh!

question: What is-
answer: Sshh! Can you hear that?

question: What?
answer: Just listen.

question: I literally hear nothing. Wait...
answer: SAUL!!!

question: ARGHHH!!!
answer: Shit. AAAAAHHHHHHH!!!

question: Let me in! Let me in! Let's go! Go!
answer: Is there anyone even out there?!?

question: I don't know!
answer: If you don't know then why the hell did you run like that?!?

question: I don't know! I'm freaking out, man! Let's just go!
answer: No! We're not going anywhere!

question: But there could be something out there!
answer: There's nothing out there, that's why we're here. God, man, you scared the fucking shit out of me.

question: Well, I'm not getting out of the car. I'm staying in the car. Talk radio? You fuckin' joshin' me? Why don't we just shoot ourselves in the nuts?
answer: Shut up, okay? It's my car.

question: Fine. Well, I'm going to smoke a joint before I go to sleep, and don't worry about it, even though you're being a dick, it's on the house.
answer: Don't do me any fucking favors. I got my own.

question: Thanks to me!
answer: Shut up. Saul. Saul. Get up. Wake up.

question: Fuck me.
answer: What's the time?

question: It's too early. It's... This can't be right.
answer: What does it say?

question: It says, uh... It couldn't be three in the morning, could it?
answer: It's three o'clock!?! We were supposed to be there at noon!

question: Wait! My grandma's clocks! It's daylight savings! Fuck! No! They go forwards an hour! Dammit-
answer: It's four o'fucking clock?!

question: -I didn't go to my Grandma's! Fuck! And we've gotta call Red.
answer: How?

question: We'll find a pay pho...fuck! His number was in my phone!
answer: You remember where he lives, right?

question: Yes, I remember. What the hell is that supposed to mean? Are you insinuating I'm forgetful? That's right, I know the word insinuating.
answer: Let's just get out of here. What the fuck? Come on. I think the battery's dead.

question: Are you fucking serious?
answer: It's dead.

question: It's dead? What the fuck happened? How did this happen?
answer: How? We fell asleep!

question: Yeah. With your stupid talk radio. No surprise, that stuffs, like, made to put people to sleep.
answer: We gotta...let's just...we'll walk. We'll walk to a road and hitchhike to Red's.

question: For real?
answer: Yeah, "for real". We'll be late, but we'll get there. Then we can fix this insane situation. Stop fucking around, man. Come on. Leave that thing alone.

question: It's like, my thumb is my cock! Thanks a fucking ton, Sharid.
answer: So, what's this guy like?

question: I don't know. He's short...and stout. So he's like a tea pot. Hehe.
answer: Well, do you think he'll be there?

question: Whoa! Dude, have you been crying?
answer: What? Oh, I uh... ...I got a cold sore, I've never got one before. I started crying.

question: A cold sore? Is that fucking herpes?
answer: ...uh, yeah, man.

question: DALE! HELP! Red, you motherfucker.
answer: It's happening! It's actually happening! He knows my name! Red knows my name!

question: We should beat it out of his sellout brains. You're a shitty friend, Red! Fuck the Casino! Go alone!
answer: This is fucked, what do we do now, he knows my name!?!

question: He knows my name too!
answer: Well what do we do? He's gonna tell them!

question: We're not gonna have to kill him, are we? I don't think I could do that. Maybe we could talk him into killing himself, or, like, make him promise not to tell.
answer: Well, we have to find out what he knows.

question: Who were they?
answer: They work for Ted. Budlofsky and Matheson. Fuckin' crazy weird guys. They were here all day, but you guys didn't show. They said they'd kill me if I didn't bring you to them, they said I'd-

question: How many cops does he have in his...uh, payroll, or whatever?
answer: I know there's this lady cop. He could have more, I don't know. He's got pretty crazy connections. He's also got a cool- ass hideout. It's crazy man. Listen, I-

question: Who's his competition?
answer: The Asians!

question: Asians? Which Asians? Indians are technically Asian.
answer: The...the Koreans, I think. Everyone just calls them the Asians.

question: Alright. We should...tie him up and...and get the fuck out of here.
answer: I made a gravity bong here once. I know where his duct tape is. Come on, let's tape this piece of shit up. I can't find the edge.

question: What?
answer: I can't find the, oh...wait... Shit. They're actually here to kill him.

question: What do we do?
answer: I don't know.

question: In here!
answer: No. I've got to get to a phone!

question: We should hide!
answer: But, if Red tells Ted's guys my name, then they'll go to my apartment and find out about Angie!

question: I think we should stay!
answer: Why?!

question: Dude, stay here. I'll be back in a minute.
answer: Hells no! I don't want to be alone! I want to go with you!

question: Saul, just watch my back. I'll literally be five minutes. Please.
answer: Fine. But hurry.

question: Listen. There are people after us and they could come here. I'll tell you anything you want, just please, let's go!
answer: He's serious?

question: Yes, I'm serious. Super serious! We have to get the "F" out of here!
answer: Get the hell out of my house.

question: Who are these people? Why are they-
answer: I think their drug dealers.

question: Why?
answer: Well, it's complicated. See, the...uh...it doesn't matter right now, we just have to get out of here.

question: Let's go to the police!
answer: No, they are the police!

question: You... huff ...Angie? Dale! It's happening!
answer: EEEHHHH!!!

question: ARGGG!!!
answer: Dale, it's one of the drug dealers!!!

question: Sir, please, he's my friend, he's helping me, he's-
answer: Stop shooting, man! I'm Dale's dealer

question: Guys! Please! We have to get out of here. Robert, Angie...Mrs. Anderson-
answer: It's Shannon.

question: Ready?
answer: No. One sec.

question: Hurry the fuck up.
answer: Chill out, man. You're nagging isn't helping.

question: Alright, baby. Here's the plan - go to the Holiday Inn downtown and use a fake name. Something like... Car...lyle.
answer: Carlyle? I...I have so many questions. I just...how can this be happening? Where...where are you going?

question: I have to stop this. I don't know how, but don't worry. I'll keep you safe. But still, watch your back. You never know where they might be, whoever they are. I love you.
answer: Uh...thanks.

question: Um...you're welcome. And nice to meet you guys.
answer: Why aren't we in that car?

question: Let's run, man! Run!
answer: Huff Huff Where are we running?

question: A fork?
answer: A bloody fork. In his girlfriends house. And the blood was fresh.

question: Maybe he killed her, to protect himself.
answer: Or maybe it's the Asians fucking with us. What the fuck is going on! Any luck with the cell phones?

question: They smashed one and left the other one in the woods to distract us. Took us an hour to find it. And we found Denton's car, which was filled with all these strange disguises. These guys are for real.
answer: I want to talk to the Asians. Get me Cheung's number. Now.

question: I want to talk to the Asians. Get me Cheung's number. Now.
answer: Hello?

question: Cheung. It's Ted.
answer: Record this conversation. Ted. This is surprising. What would you like?

question: Cheung, I want you to call off your man Denton. I don't know what he is, a scout, assassin, and frankly I don't care. I just want him gone. I want him dead. If you do this, I'll consider it a peace offering, otherwise, you're asking for war. And just in case you forgot, I'm number one, and there's a reason for that. You've got 24 hours to reply.
answer: Ted Jones is slipping. Our assassin failed to kill him, but it did rattle his confidence. It's earlier than planned, but we should strike now, while he is confused. Let it be known- -Li-Youngs death will not be in vain.

question: Victory joint complete. Here ya go.
answer: "Tell us what you know!" How fuckin' balls was that?

question: Like, really balls.
answer: And I think I fought pretty well, don't you? You know, for my first time. We were like Tango and Cash, man.

question: Or Scarface!
answer: BOOM! Knocked the door right off it's hinges!

question: And you probably saved Angie, which is fucking pimp.
answer: I probably couldn't have done it without you. Thanks, man. It is fucking pimp.

question: We're in this together, right? So, ya know.
answer: Thanks, man. You know, my last dealer was a total dick. You're by far the coolest dealer I've ever had.

question: Wow. Thanks, man. I seriously appreciate that.
answer: Yeah...like, the time before last time, I totally had weed. I just kind of wanted to chill with you.

question: Really? That's awesome, man. That means a lot to me, `cause, like, plenty of dudes come in to buy and pretend to be all buddy-buddy with me, but in my head I'm always, like, "you don't like me, you like my drugs, so fuck you, buddy!" You know? And just so you know, I totally could have lit that cross-joint on my own. I'd just have to use candles, but, like, I've never smoked one of those with anyone before.
answer: So, do you think we should leave town? We could just get on a bus and go, right?

question: We only have, like, fifty bucks. I don't think that could even pay for one ticket.
answer: What about your sack?

question: Oh man. It's still fucking killing me.
answer: No dude, your sack of weed. Can't we sell some?

question: Of course. That's my bread and butter. We just have to go to a highschool. It's the easiest market. Chester A. Arthur is like, a block a way.
answer: No way, man. I'm not going to sell to kids.

question: Why? They're gonna get it from somewhere. I mean, we got it from guys like us.
answer: Well, then not kids at that school.

question: Well, there's a bunch of private ones nearby, but they're into way crazier shit than weed-
answer: I can't do it, man. I'm not going to a high school is there anywhere else we could go?

question: We could go to Crackhead Park.
answer: What's that?

question: It's a park. Really close, actually. Full of crackheads. They smoke weed too, though. Hey, stop it. Stop it. You wanna buy some weed, or, like, what? See, that's the problem around here. Target demographic has a real, uh, fickle attention span. You gotta wow `em. Hey! Who wants some weed!?!
answer: Fuck this place.

question: Yo. `sup. You guys want some chronic?
answer: Man, this is great.

question: I got like, thirty for my Bar Mitzvah.
answer: I touched Jessica Lubell's tit at your Bar Mitzvah.

question: You touched a tit when you were twelve?
answer: Fuck that, dude. Angie in 12th grade has, like, the sweetest tits ever.

question: Don't move! Don't move! This stuff hurts. What's in your hand? Selling pot to my students isn't "decriminalized." I'm the liaison officer for this school and I just caught four students showing off handfuls of marijuana to their friends. They told me they got it back here. Put your hands up.
answer: Wait! I wasn't selling anything! All I have is this little joint.

question: You call this little?
answer: I don't even have any money! How did I sell weed if I don't have any money?!? I was just smoking it. I swear. Please.

question: You don't understand! You have to let me go! Dirty cops are gonna kill me! Please! This...this lady cop, and these guys Budlofsky and Matheson, they all work for Ted Jones, and-
answer: Ted Jones?

question: Yeah. With grey-hair. Tell me you know what I'm talking about. He lives near Evergreen Heights. He-
answer: Are you telling me you saw Ted Jones and a police office shoot someone?

question: Yeah. An Asian someone.
answer: Stay calm, do as your told, I'll get you down to the station.

question: Yes ma'am.
answer: Oh my god! Is that blood? Oh my god!

question: No! She was going to help us!
answer: Oh...my balls...I seriously think I popped one...

question: IT'S HER! The lady cop!
answer: Then who's that? The slurpee! I can't see!

question: Turn on the wipers!
answer: Dude, I seriously can't see!

question: Kick out the window! Isn't that what they do?
answer: I don't know. Okay. Oh fuck! Shit!

question: Get it out of there!
answer: Ah! Ah! My leg!

question: She's following us! She's gaining on us!
answer: Her car's better! Ha! I can see! Through my leg hole!

question: Do something!
answer: Hold on. I've got an idea.

question: WHAT THE FUCK WAS THAT?!?!?
answer: Oh shit, man! I'm sorry! I thought she'd keep going.

question: Turn on the sirens!
answer: Run!

question: Saul! Saul! I'm locked in! You dumb fucking fuck!!! HELP ME!!!
answer: So... huff ... huff ...fuckin' sorry... huff ...forgot...

question: Don't touch me, you asshole!
answer: Okay, only one way to do this, hard and fast. Bend over.

question: Ow! Ow! Hurry!
answer: I am!

question: Which saw do you like most?
answer: The brown ones nice, but the metallic ones seems more...

question: Okay, I'm going to go call Angie. Be right back.
answer: A thank you would be nice!

question: Could I have the, uh, Carlyle room, please?
answer: Dale?

question: Angie! Thank god you're okay!
answer: I'm fine. How are you? Are you okay?

question: I'm great. I'm fine. I miss you. So, here's the plan, babe. I'm going to leave town and contact a government official or something. From somewhere safe. I know this shit is all fucked up and I just can't apologize enough.
answer: Dale. I've realized some problems and-

question: I know there's a problem! That's the thing, that's why I-
answer: Dale, shut up and listen. People are trying to kill you, and me! Dale, drug dealers are trying to kill me, because of you! It's fucking over, man. Are you kidding me? For gods sake...

question: Angie, no! No! Don't you get it? I was thrown into this situation, I had no control, but I am dealing with it. This kind of thing happens, you know-
answer: NO! IT DOESN"T! You're immature, Dale! I'm six years younger and I'm saying this! And the fact that you think you're some kind of fucking genius just makes it a hundred times more infuriating!

question: What? You're telling me you think I'm a dumb guy?
answer: You're not how you think you are Dale, and it's pathetic. Call me when I can go home.

question: Alrghit, I'll see you soon. And I'm sorry again about the clocks. Ha! What a douche bag. Yeah, love you too. Yo, so before we go on the lamb I gotta go see my grandma, okay? She was worried `cause I didn't show up to help with the locks. But before that I've got to smoke another bowl.
answer: Are you joking? You're actually gonna smoke marijuana?

question: Why not?
answer: How can you smoke marijuana after what we just went through? That clearly happened because we were smoking marijuana.

question: No. It happened because those fucking kids didn't keep that shit on the down low. Which is weird, `cause they really seemed like cool kids.
answer: If you haven't noticed, we're not very functional when we're stoned, Saul.

question: When I saved you with those Slurpees I was stoned. What do you gotta say to that? Maybe the pot is what gave me the creative capacity to come up with such a great plan! The Beatles were high!
answer: You didn't save me! She was going to protect us, and now we're wanted for all sorts of crazy shit! Fine. Smoke marijuana. But you know how "Scarface" ends. Face down, dead, in your own fuckin' water fountain.

question: For one thing, I'm done dealing pot. Mostly, because I don't know where I would get it now, but still. And "b", fuck you, man. You can't judge me. We're exactly the same, and this whole thing's your fucking fault. You're the one who dropped the roach!
answer: It's not my fault! It's marijuana's fault!

question: Stop calling it marijuana!
answer: Grow up, you fucking two year old.

question: See! This is why you're a douche bag, Denton. Because you think you're better than others, but you're just a dumb pothead burnout, same as me.
answer: Maybe I am a pothead burnout, but at least I'm not the dumbest most annoying guy in the world. The only reason I ever bought weed from you was because you're shit is so good, not because you're cool.

question: But you said you bought when you already had a few times, just to hang out?
answer: Bullshit! I just like...liked having lots of different kinds of weed at once.

question: Here. Buy yourself a good last meal. Super size it, bitch.
answer: Saul! I'm sorry, man! I didn't mean all that! Saul!

question: Hey! Mrs. Mendelson! HOLY SHIT!!!
answer: Eat it!

question: Mrs. Corber! You gotta hide me!
answer: AHH!!! FUCK!!!

question: Hello? Anyone here? Red? Oh my god.
answer: What? Who the fuck! Stay the fuck back, Denton! I didn't do shit! I'll gut ya if I have to, tooled ya once, tool ya again!

question: I...what? I'm not here to fight, man, I-
answer: Good, man. I'm fuckin' tired. I'm dyin', Denton. Fuckin' shot. Right here- I'm having a little going away party and I don't remember inviting you, cocksucker. So I'm gonna ask you to leave. In my dying moments, I don't want some asshole I barely know around.

question: Go to the hospital, man! Are you crazy. You don't have to die.
answer: Yes I do! What? I go to the hospital, I'm gonna end up in But that doesn't matter `cause once Ted finds out, which he will, I'm dead wherever I am. I'm fucked through and through. Now if you'd be willing to give a dying man his wish, could ya run on into the other room and pop in disc two of Tu Pacs "All Eyez On Me". I want to listen to it while I die.

question: You don't have to die.
answer: Will you stop saying that, I've excepted it, man. I'm at peace. cough

question: Red, I need you to tell me where Ted's base is. He took Saul, and I can't bail on him. I'm going to get him back.
answer: Fuckin eh, amigo. Blaze of glory, motherfucker. This is awesome! We're so gonna show those motherfuckers. Think they can kill me? Fuck no, you can't! Not how I roll.

question: What are you doing?
answer: So, this is the backside of the farm. If you stay low in the grass you should be fine. If someone is shooting at you with an automatic weapon, zig zag. It makes you harder to hit.

question: You're not coming to help?
answer: Fuck no! I've been shot. By these guys. I was in shock before, but the air on the drive cleared my mind, I should get to the hospital. You saw Reservoir Dogs, right? I got shot in the best spot possible. I could have a long and fruitful life ahead of me. Full of possibilities. Go get `em, slugger.

question: But how do I get out of here if I rescue Saul?
answer: I've no idea. I'm sure it won't be that hard. Kill some dude and take his car, or just take it or whatever. Good luck, amigo!

question: I had to try.
answer: Dale!?! What the fuck? Did you rat me out, you shitty bastard? That what happened?

question: No! I came here to save you!
answer: To save me? Ha! That's rich! You're caught, too. And now I have to die with some asshole.

question: Saul, I deserved that, because I fucked you. You're right, this whole things my fault, and they only way I can make it up to you is by rescuing you, and that's why I'm here. To save my friend.
answer: Tell ya what, Dale. You actually save me and I'll consider forgiving you for this mad shit.

question: Good. `Cause I will.
answer: Oh really? What, you forget to tell me you shoot lasers out of your eyes, or you got some kind of secret blowtorch strapped to your dick? We're not gonna escape, Dale, we're losers, and sinners, and after we die, we're gonna go to hell!

question: Dale? You're alive!
answer: What happened?

question: They got your ear.
answer: My what?

question: Here. Get up.
answer: AAHHHH!!! MY EAR!!! YOU KILLED MY EAR!!!

question: Look at all this fucking weed, man. Where the hell are we? Is this some underground weed city we don't know about? What's that noise?
answer: I don't know! That guy just blew half my fucking ear off!

question: There's some dudes in here. I saw them when I got dragged down. And there's some kind of super-suit or something.
answer: Were they armed?

question: I don't think so.
answer: I can't hear them.

question: You could boost me up! We'll sneak out.
answer: Shoot back!

question: Really?
answer: YES! Now run! Nice. You got him. Holy shit. I killed him.

question: About time you killed somebody. You're the one whose supposed to be saving me, and I`ve killed two bad guys already.
answer: You'll never be able to pull me up, but I'll boost you up there and you just fucking run for it, man.

question: What? No fucking way, Dale. What about you?
answer: Don't worry about me.

question: Whoa. That was awesome. You're a good man, Dale Denton.
answer: Hold on!

question: Holy fuck! Holy fuck! Aaaahhhh!!! Ow. Ah. Ow. Okay... cough cough Saul! Saul! Cough Cough You're okay!
answer: Cough Cough What the fuck happened?

question: We... Cough ...we did it. We beat them. We won.
answer: No fucking way. Seriously? How did that happen?

question: I have absolutely no idea.
answer: They were fighting Asian dudes, man.

question: Asian dudes? So, okay...maybe this is revenge for that Asian dude I saw Ted kill.
answer: So we're, like, in a drug war. That's cool.

question: What's cool is that you came back for me man. You did, right? You weren't just captured again, were you?
answer: Hell no! I was scott-free. But how the hell was I going to leave you there after you came to save me? Fuck that.
